definition:
A topological space $X$ is said to be *pseudocompact* if every
continuous function $f\colon X\to\R$ has bounded image.

All countably compact spaces (which includes all compact spaces and all
sequentially compact spaces) are pseudocompact. A metric space is
pseudocompact if and only if it is compact. A Hausdorff normal space is
pseudocompact if and only if it is countably compact.
